FactTweet: There are seven species of bat living within the chicago city limits.
FactText: There are seven species of bat living within the chicago city limits.

FactTweet: You can find bats in Chicago's forest preserves, golf courses, church attics, and boardwalks.
FactText: You can find bats all over Chicago, at the forest preserves, on golf courses, in church attics, and boardwalks.

FactTweet: The eastern pipistrille is the smallest bat species in Chicago, weighing only as much as a penny.
FactText: The eastern pipistrille is the smallest bat species in Chicago, weighing only as much as a penny.

FactTweet: After the Haymarket bombing Chicago put 8 anarchists on trial but only a few were present for the crime.
FactText: After Chicago's famous Haymarket bombing, the city put eight labor radicals and all were found guilty even though most of the men had not been present at the scene.

FactTweet: Chicago's famous Haymarket bombing occurred during the first-ever national general strike in 1886.
FactText: Chicago's famous Haymarket bombing occurred during the first-ever national general strike in 1886.

FactTweet: The protestors at Chicago's haymarket bombing of 1886 were laborers calling for an 8 hour workday.
FactText: The protestors at Chicago's haymarket bombing of 1886 were laborers calling for an 8-hour workday.

FactTweet: Anarchism did not have a violent reputation until the Haymarket bombing gave it a bad name.
FactText: Before the Haymarket Bombing of 1886, Anarchism did not have a reputation of violence. It was simply one of many political philosophies.

FactTweet: During the Cold War, Chicago had 22 anti-aircraft sites for defense against air strikes
FactTease: How the Cold War missile affected our psyche.
FactText: During the Cold War, Chicago had 22 anti-aircraft sites for defense against air strikes

FactTweet: In the mid-1950s, Chicago had 600 Nike Ajax missiles, each designed to intercept a single bomber.
FactTease: How the Cold War missile affected our psyche.
FactText: In the mid-1950s, Chicago had 600 Nike Ajax missiles, each designed to intercept a single bomber.

FactTweet: During the cold war, Chicago had multiple missile sites with nuclear-tipped warheads.
FactTease: How the Cold War missile affected our psyche.
FactText: During the cold war, Chicago's anti-aircraft missile sites included nuclear-tipped warheads designed to destroy multiple aircraft at once

FactTweet: During the cold war, the army feared that Russian bombers might fly over Lake Michigan undetected.
FactTease: How the Cold War missile affected our psyche.
FactText: During the Cold War, Lake Michigan posed a security threat to the city of Chicago because radar was very limited and Russian bombers might fly over the water undetected

FactTweet: During the Cold War, the army built three nike missile sites on or near Lake Michigan.
FactTease: How the Cold War missile affected our psyche.
FactText: During the Cold War, the army built three nike missile sites on or near Lake Michigan: Belmont Harbor, Burnham Park, and Jackson Park

FactTweet: Pilsen is considered Latino community but it didn't become that way until the 60s
FactText: Pilsen and LIttle Village are both considered Latino communities but they didn't become that way until the 60s and 70s respectively.

FactTweet: The Eisenhower Expressway displaced many Mexicanswho then established a new community in Pilsen
FactText: The Eisenhower Expressway displaced many Mexicans on the near-west side who then established a new community in Pilsen.

FactTweet: Before it was a Latino neighborhood, Pilsen was mostly composed of central European immigrants.
FactText: Before it was a Latino neighborhood Pilsen was mostly composed of central European immigrants.

FactTweet: In 1889 a Cook County judge described Dunning Asylum as a "tomb for the living."
FactText: In an 1889 case in Cook County Court, a judge described Dunning Asylum for the Insane as a "tomb for the living."

FactTweet: Notorious serial killer, bigamist Johann Hoch was buried at Dunning Asylum in 1906.
FactText: One of the most notorious people buried at Cook County's Dunning Asylum for the Insane was serial killer Johann Hoch. He married 30 women and killed at least 10 of them. He was hanged in 1906.

FactTweet: In 1989 a construction project uncovered remnants of a vast cemetery near the former Dunning Asylum.
FactText: In 1989, a backhoe operator working on Chicago's Northwest Side found a corpse. That led to an assessment that between 15,000 and 38,000 people had once been buried nearby, at Dunning Asylum and related facilities.

FactTweet: In 1989 a Civil War veteran's remains were recovered from a construction site. The body was mostly intact.
FactText: In 1989, the remains of a Civil War veteran were recovered from the former potters field associated with the Dunning Asylum site. The body was mostly intact, having been embalmed with arsenic.

FactTweet: It is safe to eat many Lake Michigan fish but you shouldn't do it more than once a week!
FactText: It is safe to eat many Lake Michigan fish but only in moderation. To be safe, you should only eat Lake-caught fish once a week.

FactTweet: Some fish from Lake Michigan are safe to eat but stay away from Lake Trout, Catfish, and Carp.
FactText: Some fish from Lake Michigan are safe to eat but stay away from Lake Trout, Catfish, and Carp. They are too contaminated with chemicals like PCBs.

FactTweet: Many of Chicago's two-flat homes were built by Bohemian (Czech) immigrants at the turn of the century.
FactText: Many of Chicago's two-flat homes were built by second generation Bohemian (Czech) immigrants at the turn of the century.

FactTweet: Chicago's Pilsen neighborhood was named for the town Plzeň in the Bohemian region of the Czech Republic.
FactText: Chicago's Pilsen neighborhood used to be predominately Czech. It was named for the town Plzeň in the Bohemian region of the Czech Republic.

FactTweet: California Avenue got its name because it was a "western paradise" for upwardly mobile Czechs buying new homes.
FactText: California Avenue got its name because it was a "western paradise" for upwardly mobile Czechs as they moved out of Pilsen and bought new homes.

FactTweet: The mysteriously popular water pump in Schiller Woods Park is a rare source of spring water in the Chicago area
FactText: The mysteriously popular water pump in Schiller Woods Park is a rare source of spring water in the Chicago area.

FactTweet: The Schiller Woods pump attracts crowds for its mythical superior water but it has typical mineral content.
FactText: The water pump at Schiller Woods park attracts crowds for it's mythical superior water. But chemical tests show that the pump's mineral content is typical for well water.

FactTweet: There are 212 water pumps at the Cook County Forest Preserves but the most popular one's in Schiller Woods park.
FactText: There are 212 water pumps at the Cook County Forest Preserves but the most popular and storied pump is located in Schiller Woods park.

FactTweet: The famous Chicago accent stays the same from neighborhood to neighborhood.
FactText: The Chicago accent doesn't vary from neighborhood to neighborhood. That famous raised "A" vowel sounds the same all over Chicago.

FactTweet: The most common feature of the Chicago accent is the raised "A" vowel which turns "Hat" into "H-ea-t"
FactText: The most common feature of the Chicago accent is the raised "A" vowel which turns "Hat" into "H-ea-t"

FactTweet: Some Chicago panhandlers can make up to $100 or $200 per day if they stand in areas with high pedestrian traffic
FactText: Some Chicago panhandlers can make up to $100 or $200 per day if they stand in areas with high pedestrian traffic.

FactTweet: The hourly wage for Chicago street performers varies but during rush hour they can make $30 to $40 per hour.
FactText: The hourly wage for Chicago street performers varies but during rush hour they can make $30 to $40 per hour. At less busy times it's more like $10.

FactTweet: Chicago's 1903 Iroquois Theater fire was the deadliest single-building fire in the U.S. until Sept. 11, 2001.
FactText: In 1903, 600 people died in a fire at the Iroquois Theater. It was the deadliest single-building fire in U.S. history until the World Trade Center attacks in 2001.

FactTweet: A fire at Chicago's Iroquois Theater killed 2x as many people as the Great Fire did ... within 15 minutes.
FactText: About twice as many people known to have died in the Great Chicago Fire died within 15 minutes during Chicago's Iroquois Theater fire.

FactTweet: Fact: The alley behind the Oriental Theater is also known as the Alley Of Death And Mutilation. Why?
FactText: The alley behind the Oriental Theater is also known as the The Alley of Death And Mutilation, per a 1903 Chicago Tribune article.
